verse.roman:
ekam pādaṁ padākramya
dorbhyām anyaṁ pragṛhya saḥ
gudataḥ pāṭayām āsa
śākham iva mahā-gajaḥ

synonyms: ekam—one; pādam—leg; padā—with his foot; ākramya—standing on top of; dorbhyām—with his two hands; anyam—the other; pragṛhya—taking hold of; saḥ—he; gudataḥ—beginning from the anus; pāṭayām āsa—tore him asunder; śākhām—a tree branch; iva—as; mahā—great; gajaḥ—an elephant.
translation: Bhīma pressed down on one leg with his foot while grabbing Jarāsandha's other leg in his hands, and just as a great elephant might break the branch of a tree, Bhīma tore Jarāsandha apart from the anus upward.
